column4: hi, i have a pretty noobish question.. can you use any windows installer with wine?
yes but weather or not it will work is a different matter. Check appdb for compatibility
i just mean, could i go download any trial of a windows program and it shall work if known to work? :P
sure, as long as the appdb says its ok then you'll be ok
alright, that's all i wanted to know. thanks, and also thanks _Marcus for the link. (:
the appd also has little hints on settings too
can you give a pastebin of the output of:   sudo apt-get update     close software centre and such first
if you'd added to PPA correctly, you wouldn't have this issue
its a single command to add both PPA and key..
http://www.winehq.org/download/ubuntu    states:   sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ubuntu-wine/ppa     and you are done. You don't need this as you already have the PPA added
do you use xrandr at all?
press CTRL+ALT+F1 and log in and run:   mv ~/.config/monitors.xml $HOME; sudo reboot
